title: Born in Zundert, Netherlands
description: Vincent Willem van Gogh was born to Theodorus van Gogh, a minister, and Anna Cornelia Carbentus.

title: Begins work at Goupil & Cie art dealers
description: Van Gogh starts working at his uncle's art dealership in The Hague, beginning his exposure to the art world.

title: Decides to become an artist
description: After working as a teacher and missionary, Van Gogh decides to dedicate his life to art, supported by his brother Theo.

title: Completes 'The Potato Eaters'
description: Van Gogh's first major work, depicting peasant life with dark, somber tones characteristic of his early Dutch period.

title: Moves to Paris
description: Van Gogh moves to Paris to live with his brother Theo, where he encounters Impressionism and Post-Impressionism, dramatically changing his style.

title: Moves to Arles
description: Seeking inspiration from the bright light of Provence, Van Gogh moves to Arles and rents the Yellow House.

title: Paints 'Sunflowers'
description: Van Gogh creates his famous sunflower series, using vibrant yellows to express joy and gratitude.

title: Paints 'The Bedroom'
description: Van Gogh paints his bedroom in Arles, creating an intimate and peaceful scene using bold colors and simple forms.

title: Ear incident
description: After a confrontation with Paul Gauguin, Van Gogh cuts off part of his left ear and is hospitalized.

title: Voluntarily enters Saint-Rémy asylum
description: Van Gogh admits himself to the Saint-Paul-de-Mausole asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence for treatment.

title: Paints 'The Starry Night'
description: One of Van Gogh's most famous works, painted from memory and imagination, featuring a swirling night sky over a village.

title: Paints 'Irises'
description: Van Gogh paints vibrant irises, celebrating the birth of his nephew Vincent Willem.

title: Moves to Auvers-sur-Oise
description: Van Gogh moves to Auvers-sur-Oise, near Paris, under the care of Dr. Gachet, hoping for recovery.

title: Paints 'Portrait of Dr. Gachet'
description: Van Gogh paints two versions of his physician, Dr. Gachet, showing deep psychological insight.

title: Paints 'Wheatfield with Crows'
description: One of Van Gogh's final paintings, often interpreted as expressing his emotional turmoil and sense of foreboding.

title: Dies in Auvers-sur-Oise
description: Van Gogh dies from a self-inflicted gunshot wound at the age of 37. His brother Theo dies six months later.
